comment.text: Everything I needed and more. The online ordering systems didn't show the shrimp and grits, which is what I really wanted, to be ordered so I got the catfish and grits with a side of shrimp - OMG. This food hit the spot and I'll be sure to return the next time I'm in ATL. I do want to try the strawberry shortcake French toast, but will definitely keep my same order for other future visits.

Second visit here and successfully brunch day. I set a reservation and was seated as soon as I walked in. The restaurant was busy as usual but it wasn't crowded. The ambiance was good. Conversations going on at the bar and tables. Music was playing in the background but not loudly. The staff is attentive and nice. Our waiter was good and knew the menu and "fan favs". The food presentation was great. The food was good. Pricing was fair. I would recommend if you've never been.

photos.caption: Lennox ave breakfast. Shrimp and grits. Cookies and cream French toast.

comment.text:
Went on Friday for brunch. Could not believe how packed it was! Definitely make a reservation. 

The meals we ordered were delicious (salmon cakes with grits & eggs, the apple cobbler French toast). Not being dramatic when I say the biscuit is one of the best I've ever had. The only thing slightly disappointing was the mac&cheese. Also wish they did some form of bottomless drink options. Would recommend.

Went to Toast and was pleasantly surprised by the level of service and quality of the food. In particular, the bartender, Kim (or Kam) was phenomenal. She so happened to be covering a Friday shift, because she's normally there on the weekends (Saturdays and Sundays). She was so sweet and kind and her drinks were on point!!! I had (several) a lychee peach lemon drops and a french 75. She did not disappoint. I hope that management understands how much of an asset she is to the restaurant, because she made my overall experience amazing. I'm definitely coming back just to see her and have drinks. 

The food was delicious, fast, and of quality. You can tell the chef/cooks are paying attention to details. I had the seafood gumbo, GA honey hot fried chicken and catfish with a side of macaroni, and the blackened salmon and shrimp. Everything was great! That honey hot sauce is a must!!! 

The restaurant was cute, clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

My daughter and I arrived at 12:41 pm to dine in on a Sunday for brunch. We didn't have reservations as this was a spur of the moment kind of thing and we drove an hour and half to visit Atlanta. We were told it would be a 90 minute wait. According to their policy, you technically have 90 minutes to dine so it appears we were simply waiting for a table to become available. We were seated at 1:21 pm. I didn't realize the dining area was so small. 

Overall, we loved our food. If you're concerned about the dress code, there are wasn't any. Just be you! The only reason I'm awarding four star is because I have to consider that if we had not ordered our food when we initially sat down, it would have taken forever to receive our dishes. We didn't receive our food until 1:56 pm. It seemed like forever and just took too long.

photos.caption: Bananas Foster French Toast $18  and Smoked Applewood Bacon $6
Mimosa $16 + an additional $0.50 for the strawberry flavor
Blackened salmon & shrimp with collards and roasted potatoes instead of yams $39

comment.text: Visiting from out of town and heard it was a must try. I will say thank God for reservations because the wait would be insane. My overall experience was a nice vibe. I've never had fried green tomatoes with blue cheese, wasn't my thing. The catfish and grits were really. I didn't give 5 stars bc I couldn't exchange a dish. That braised beef rib skillet was definitely not braised short ribs at all. Taste like overcooked beef stew. So I had to pay for something I couldn't stomach. You really can't talk about service bc gratuity is added no matter what. You get what you get. My group thought the food was just ok, not amazing. I did enjoy the catfish and lemon drop martini.

Visiting from out of town and saw the great reviews and delicious menu items. Toast did not disappoint! Staff was friendly, service was quick and the food was sooo good. I had the chicken and waffles and my husband had the hot honey card oh that came with collards and yams which he doesn't usually like but this changed his mind about yams. Will be back next time I am in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Chicken and waffles - hot honey catfish in the back

comment.text:
5 Stars. Just go lol so good.
We visited toast again yesterday and the service and cooks were wonderful. My husband had fish, shrimp and grits with the cinnamon waffle and my daughter had the hot honey wings with a fruity pebbles waffle. I ordered the brisket hash. Everything was spectacular!! Worth every dime spent.

Had the opportunity to go to Toast on Lennox's new midtown location for a girls brunch during what I like to call "Beyoncé weekend".

The good: The food is bomb! I had the sweet potato waffle with the fried lobster tail. Definitely pricey at almost $50, but was delicious and worth the indulgence. I also had the Mac and cheese which was good as well. Most of the party got Mimosas. They were ok, for almost $20 each I expected them to be made with fresh muddled fruit for flavoring but the flavoring was from syrup. If I go back I'd likely try a different beverage option. 

The bad: The wait . We each tried to make a reservation both online and via phone but never got a hold of anyone. One of my friends got to the restaurant at 11a and put our party of 8 down for a table. We were told a 1-1.5 hour wait max. Fast forward 2 hours and we were still waiting. Each time we checked on our wait time we were told "soon,  soon". It took us 3 hours to be seated! Now, I totally understand that we did not have reservations, but if you could not accommodate our party - just say that! Don't have us waiting in the hot ATL sun for hours on end. If I went back it'd only be with a reservation or on a weekday.

See more on my IG @dr_kjsmith
Food was delicious, staff was friendly and helpful and the environment was cute!! We had the Lenox breakfast, fish and grits and banana froster French toast!!

So this post is about a month old.. but I have to tell you that Toast is awesome! My daughter and I went there for brunch the day after the Beyoncé concert.

The food was outstanding! I had the fried lobster with greens and smoked Gouda Mac n cheese - my mouth is watering writing this post! Greens and ere better than my moms (shhhh...)

My daughter had the chicken and waffles which was as also amazing! Chicken was well seasoned and waffle was perfect.

Wait staff was very attentive and courteous.

Add Toast to your list!

photos.caption: Fried lobster, smoked Gouda Mac-n- Cheese, greens; chicken and waffles with potatoes

comment.text:
First time here yesterday. 
FOOD: I had the waffle & chicken. THOSE WAFFLES WERE SOFT! & the sauce on it was BOMB! The chicken was seasoned well & you can taste the flavor. 
AMBIANCE: the decor was cute and aesthetically 
SERVICE: was really good from the valet to our waitress.  I really appreciate good customer service!

I would recommend this place(it does get pack FAST) and the wait to get your food is a bit slow, HOWEVER, I rather have my food come out slow and hot, and then fast and cold.

Get there an hour before they open, Lol. The Catfish and Grits are amazing! The fish is fried to perfection, the grits are creamy, and the creole sauce is the best! 
The Hennessy Sangria's are GOOD! 
Service was good. The waiter was welcoming and was able to answer questions quickly.
The ambiance was kool. It's usually packed though. 
There's a parking lot with valet, or a small chance at self parking. 
Don't forget to take pics outside of the restaurant in front of the grass wall.

We came here for brunch. In Atlanta they don't serve mimosas before 11am and we were there around 10am.

This restaurant gets extremely crowded that's why we came early.

We had the best waiter (Jay) he was on point. It was 7 picky people in our
Group and he got our orders right.

I ordered the Lenox Ave Breakfast and it was plenty of food and the food was really good.

We waited until 11am and ordered the Toast bottle of champagne and it was enough for everyone at the table to have a mimosa.

We had a great time at Toast.

I attended Toast Midtown for the birthday on a Friday morning and it was probably the best experience I had while dining out in a while.
Okay from the top...
Reservations- booked online and honored perfectly.
Parking- a little confusing as there is no street parking but signs pointing down the street to park in the Spice House parking lot which is ample. My reservations were pretty early at 930 so there was plenty parking. I believe it's Valet but maybe I avoided it by the time of our reservations since it was so early.
Food- amaze balls. We ordered the seafood dip, crab Benedict, small order of bananas foster French toast and the basic breakfast (forgot the name) that has eggs, chicken sausage and a biscuit with grits. Everything was tasty and not overpowering. We had a mimosa and a peach sweet tea which tasted great also.
The service- A1. Our hostess and waiter were great. Our server who I think was either Leon/Luis was great. He was very attentive not overbearing and knowledgeable about the menu. Greatest service I've had in a while. 
Ambiance- perfectly decorated. Even the bathrooms were nicely decorated equipped with hand salt, lotions and soaps.
There is an outside area but given it August it had a lot of flies when I went to take photos. So I'd probably stay in.
I'm booking my next trip to toast right now!

I love this place because of the food! There are many Black-owned brunch spots in ATL but to date, this is my go to. Definitely make a reservation because even though they've opened a second location in Midtown, but stay packed every day. I've been twice and the first visit was excellent. We had a vibrant male server and a nice table in the main dining room. You will see interesting wardrobe choices and often very scantily dressed women - sort of the "City Girls" vibe. There is a small bar so you might luck up and find a seat there. Anyway the second visit was not so wonderful. I was entertaining a colleague from Dallas, made a reservation and arrived 10 minutes earlier. Another part of two jumped in front of us as we were approaching the door, and the hostess seated them in the main dining room without reservation. When she got to us (did have a reservation) she put us in the back dining room which is an unsightly plain box with very little decor or thought- like the overflow dining room in a church basement lol. I REALLY did not want to sit in that room and asked if we could be seated at either of the 2 booths open and she said no they were for others (??) What's worse is when we acquiesced to the back room there was a couple with a new baby back there. When I'm paying over $100 to eat, I prefer not to be around kids and babies. So the food was again excellent but honestly the calloused hostess pretty much ruined it for me. If they're going to have that back room, spruce it up so guests don't feel like they're in punishment or banished to the kiddie section. Female server was cool but not as engaging as the gentleman we had previously. You know in the way out I spied those 2 booths designated for others. One was still empty when we're left :(  Love the cuisine but because I am an excellent tipper, I have to decide whether it's worth it coming back.  If you haven't been, do go!!  5 stars on cuisine & menu. 3 stars on hostesses & that god awful back room

My go to brunch spot especially when I have out of town guests! The brunch at Toast cannot be beat. I love their salmon cakes and the banana foster French Toast is the best and I normally don't like French Toast. I took my mom here who is so hard to please and she won't stop talking about coming back every Sunday.

photos.caption: Salmon cakes, catfish and grits, Oreo French toast

comment.text: Let me just start with the fact that every time I've eaten here the service is Amazing and the food is even Better.  I also love the ambiance; it's not too large and not too small; but please believe me it's usually packed.  It's best to make Reservations and that is what they recommend & is preferred; but if not you may actually have luck being seated at the bar ( which doesn't require reservations).  I did remember to take great pictures this time .  I ordered the Bananas Foster French toast OMG, they were the absolute best that I've ever had.  Our Superb server was Tu'jarie , and he was definitely on his job this morning.  Very polite, knowledgeable regarding the menu and Friendly.

photos.caption: Bananas Foster French toast with scrambled eggs with cheese and mimosa.
Lenox breakfast...I think that's the name with your choice of applewood bacon, chicken sausage, turkey bacon or other / impossible meat
Salmon Cakes,eggs, roasted potatoes with biscuit

comment.text: I had a great experience here. Went on a weekday with reservations. It wasn't too busy. Food was flavorful, service was great. Shrimp and chicken sausage grits was savory, ricotta pancakes was yummy, burrito with chorizo and a side of Mac and cheese was flavorful and filling, tea (not pictured) sangria with Hennessy (I don't like Hennessy but it was good!).

photos.caption: Shrimp and grits, ricotta pancakes, burrito with chorizo, side of Mac n cheese, tea

comment.text:
Toast on Lenox is very much still a hot spot for the who's who in Atlanta. You may spot a micro influencer, or maybe a reality tv star, you may not. Wait times are not for the weak and hungry... Waiting will occur. 

There is parking and valet. I would opt for the valet because you'll be waiting to eat anyway. They do not play about reservations. Every staff member will ask you if you have them on your way in, including security. 

One of my girlfriends decided to have her birthday brunch here and it was not too bad of a wait, although all of us had to be there to be seated. Once I got there, we had to weigh an additional 15 minutes and we were seated.

Our server was Caleb, and he was very professional and helpful with the menu and any questions we had. He also served me a mocktail (not on the menu) which was delicious! The food itself is pretty good. My friend ordered the Cajun seafood dip for the table (8/10), which was served with a baguette, pre-cut to tear off slices as you ate, I ordered the beef short rib breakfast skillet. it came with a horseradish aïoli, which was surprisingly good with the potato and short rib. Yum! My friends ordered the honey hot fried catfish, shrimp and grits, and chicken and waffles, and based on their plates they liked the food! Drinks were also really good.

I like Toast because not only is it Instagrammable and great for photo-ops but the food is pretty good as well. Overall, they could do better with wait times and reservations but I would definitely recommend if you've never been.

photos.caption: Collard greens and honey hot catfish

comment.text: Toast on Lenox has been on my list of "must try" brunch spots for a long time. Finally I was able to snag a week day reservation on my hubby's birthday. Weekend reservations are pretty hard to get. When we arrived, the host seated us immediately and our server greeted us within seconds. Everything we ordered was yummy...not over or under seasoned. My very picky hubby ordered the apple cobbler French toast with honey hot fried wings on the side and a Manmosa.  10 out of 10! He liked it so much he ordered 3 orders of wings to go. I opted for the beef short rib breakfast scramble and a passion fruit mimosa. The short rib was so tender and flavorable. My only dilemma is when are we coming back??

photos.caption: Apple Cobbler French toast and hot honey chicken wings

comment.text:
I've on had takeout in the past, but the dine-in experience is dope and a whole vibe. Make a reservation and get there on-time.  Parking is ample.  

The music is stellar.  The service is stellar.  The food is stellar.  

I started with the Brussels sprouts with lemon crema.  They were so delicious and good.

My entree was the catfish and grits.  It was so delicious. 

I added on a waffle on the side.  It was perfectly prepared.  

Toast is worth the hype and the vibe.  Support this amazing Black-owned and -operated restaurant.

Sheeeeeeesh! I'm not going to lie. I avoided this place because I see it on social media a lot and I've yet to find a spot that lived up to the hype .. until Toast on Lenox. My goodness! This food was phenomenal.  

The gumbo has plenty of seafood and chicken. So much flavor. The chicken waffles are the perfect balance. I was a little concerned it would be overly sweet because of the green and caramel but it's not! It's the perfect balance of salty and sweet. The chicken was crispy and perfect. Everything was great!

The prices are high BUT fitting for Buckhead. AND they're worth it. The food is THAT good!

Food was served very , very quickly and the staff was very friendly. 

20/10 I recommend!

I went to Toast for my birthday brunch, and I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. 

Location and Parking 
It is located in a small shopping center with plenty of free parking. 

Venue and Atmosphere 
The decor consists of green, gold, black, and white. It's sophisticated and fresh, with neon lights and faux flowers as accent pieces. Gold chandeliers adorn the ceiling and the bathrooms are clean. 

Service 
Our server was kind and had a good sense of humor. 

Food and Beverages 
The shrimp and grits was some of the best I've ever had, seriously. The mimosa flavors are yummy and he biscuits are surely homemade. The seafood dip is also delicious. 

Verdict 
I will certainly be back!

I enjoy toast when I come and I come often. I don't care for their waffle that comes with the chicken and waffles but the chicken is good. I also enjoy the salmon and grits and short rib hash. All of their drinks are good. I recommend sitting at the bar or making a reservation because they are always busy.

Food is good, service is a hit or miss, ambience is boogie and the coffee is cold.  

We chanced upon some Yelp reviews on a way to another brunch spot and decided to give it a try! My first trip was as a party of 4. Minimal wait to sit outside (which we did) but a long one to be seated inside without reservations. The walk from our car was longer as the entire lot was full (and half was valet?). However you WILL find a spot and it's free parking. 

Since this was our first visit our server told us about all the items on the menu, built up a few and gave us plenty of time to order. We got the skillet, all the French toasts, the avocado toast, salmon cakes. OMG the food was great. I loved the skillet - beef was soft and seasoned so well. And I got some nice over easy eggs that were cooked beautifully. The strawberry shortcake French toast was divine and felt like a dessert after my skillet. These were my favorite two dishes so far. I heard no complaints from the others on my table to I assume everything was top notch. 

We ordered coffee for everyone and I must say that was a disappointment. My first cup was cold and came after a long long time after I ordered it. Our French toasts came out sooner. The second cup took even longer and it was warm at best.

However, our server made up for the experience, with the attention and help with some customary photos. The restaurant has some nice photo ops both in and out - so definitely make full use of them.

Given that I wanted to try other stuff on the menu, I decided to drop by again. This time it was too cold to sit out and we still didn't have any reservations. We put our name on the waitlist and started thinking of ways to kill 90 mins. Another party was also waiting and so we decided to sit at the big table right upfront rattler than stand the entire time (be aware there is barely any waiting space inside). In a few minutes the hostess came up and told us that the party that has reserved the table was a no show and if we wanted to all sit together we could have the table. No more 90 min wait - hell yes, so we became best friends with the other group and started perusing the menu again on our phones. 

This time around our sever was not as good. He took forever to greet us, or get us water. Then another decade to take our order. He didn't allow us to get any substations and was pretty grumpy all throughout. Guess what? - My coffee was cold AGAIN.  I guess they serve more cocktails than coffee ‍ to care. 

I ordered the shrimp and grits (and ARPITA B got the skillet). As I had mentioned the server did not want to make any accommodations for the potatoes in the skillet but ok! The food was yummy like the last time. The grits were creamy and soft, the shrimp and gravy was so flavorful. 

Overall, I will recommend this spot - make reservations ahead of time and definitely try and skillet and the strawberry shortcake French toast - you won't regret it.

What's remaining for the next time - cocktails - they seem to have a bunch and they all sound good.

A friend brought me here for a birthday brunch outing. It was super good. She made a reservation so we didn't have to wait. The line seemed to be dwindling down when we got there on a Sunday at 2.  There's valet parking so that was good.  

It was super crowded inside. It's decorated nicely.  We sat outside.  It is definitely a good idea to go with a group. It's hard to choose one meal. We got chicken and waffles, salmon and grits, salmon patties and grits with a side of potatoes and eggs grits and bacon. Everything and I mean everything was great!  The chicken and waffles may have been my favorite but the grits and potatoes were really good also. Just writing this review is giving me wonderful flashbacks! 

The service was great as well. Our server was friendly and helpful.  There when we needed him.  I highly recommend this spot..just make sure you have a reservation.

I can't come to Atlanta without coming her. I love the staff and the FOOD is amazing. Each dish is filled with of flavor and the drinks are incredible.  The strawberry shortcake French toast and the salmon cakes !!! Chefs kiss 

I found out the chef uses all natural ingredients and no salt and pepper.

Shrimp and grits - awful. 
Waffle and chicken - was a weird combo but it was average
Lobster and waffle - That was good but not worth the price
Cajun seafood dip - this was  only good thing here
Drinks - the mimosas were flat. I got the peach flavor - do not get that


The place was packed and managed horribly - we had to book this place almost 1 month ahead. Even after booking we had to wait for 30 mins outside in the sun(they kicked us out because there was no room)

The security guard handled everything for us(this is the 1 star- she went out of her way to get us service ) because she herself couldn't believe this service. After we got seated, our order was placed 20+ mins later.

Ambiance was noisy and people just didn't behave well. 


This was a Saturday brunch. I don't think I will be back here.

photos.caption: Garlic bread with Cajun seafood dip

comment.text:
What a 5 start experience I had at this spot to bring in the new year.  My friend and I visited New Year's Day.  We looked and looked weeks in advance attempting to get a reservation, but was not able.  We walked in at 11 on Sunday and was quoted an hour and a half wait, we inquired about sitting at the bar, and a gentleman just happened to walk up.  He led us to excellent seats at the bar and then ended up being our bartender/server.  His name was Markus and he was amazing.  So attentive and nice.  Which was the complete vibe from everyone.  Everyone spoke and smiled and the employees seemed to genuinely be happy to be at work and like each other - which is not common imo.

We decided to split a bottle of champagne with juice and my friend did the Briscuit breakfast and I did the Hot Honey chicken.  Everything was delish.  Just a great experience overall.  Will definitely be back.

So...There was a lot going on during my first visit to Toast. First, I tried to walk into the other location at some point in time and was told there was no entry without a reservation even it it was to sit at the bar. This was a Saturday... So I'm thinking, D*mn... Their food must be bussin! So I made a reservation for this lo0cation and the next available was 2 weeks out... Once again... D*mn... Their food must be bussin! The day comes, my reservation is at 2pm, I get there at 2:09pm, the other part of my party was already there inside waiting for me so we could be seated. I tell the hostess I have a reservation at 2pm and the other half of my party is already here. She tells me to stand outside... So I repeat myself because maybe she didn't hear me... She repeats herself... So I ask her if she is telling me that y 2pm reservation is not ready for us to sit yet and she snaps back at me "Well you didn't give me a name." Now Idk about you... but a neck roll turns up the attitude in me... So I snapped back "I told you I had a 2pm and you didn't ask the name! and I proceeded to spell out my name as tensions got higher... ANYWHOO We were seated immediately (Because my 2pm was ready!) You have to know I already had my mind made up about what I wanted to eat. We sit down... The waiter tells us that they were out of Brussel sprouts, salmon, short rib, chicken, sprite, and some other drink... Now go look at there menu and see what's left... I came for the short rib and Brussel sprouts because I was on a no carb diet... don't ask it was a small cheat at this point... But it turned into him finding chicken and me getting three wings. My friend had to get the French toast (Which looked AMAZING) but was too much of a stretch from my diet for me to approve the decision for myself. The music was cool, there were bar seats available for people to come in and sit at in this location. and the waitress was attentive... BUT for the two week backup that you all have... Your manager that orders your supplies should be more accurate. The chicken I ate was good, I may try again, but right now its a no for me and overhyped.

This was my first visit here- lunch on a weekday. At first I was hesitant because it looked like a big crowd and we had no reservations. Fortunately, we had no issues getting seated right away. Service was fantastic- fast, friendly and our server was very knowledgeable about the menu. The food was ah-mazing. I started with the gumbo, which was a healthy portion with large pieces of broken-down crab. Soooo good. I had the hot honey chicken with yams and collard greens for lunch. So good, I want it for dinner too! The ambiance was a cool vibe. Very "Atlanta" chic and cool! Can't wait to go back! Def would recommend a reservation though because I have a feeling we got lucky walking in today.

I've been here twice before however, my most recent visit (7.7.23) is what lead to this review. This restaurant seems to have completely changed or I simply overlooked the pricey in the past. 

Previously, the GA Hot Honey Fried Chicken was a quarter or half chicken. I don't remember but I know it wasnt 3 wings. The change to the 3 wings wasn't the problem, but rather the price didn't decrease along with the portion size. There was even less collards and yams than before. I asked the server why the change and he said it was do to customers complaining about the size of the one wing on the previously served quarter/half chicken. It didn't make sense but okay, sure. I don't think the change is worth $27 (pic attached) 

Now, on to my biggest issue. The coercion from our server to manipulate his way into a larger tip. I hate I didn't pick up on it in the moment. We get our checks, he goes to my cousin first and she asked if the 18% was his tip included. He said no. He said it's a service fee that goes to the restaurant and divided amongst the different positions. However, the menu said 18% gratuity is included (I checked after we left). I reached out to the restaurant to get clarity on exactly who the 18% goes to. Our server went on to explain how he has to tip out the bar and bussers (which is normal, I've been a server before). He told us they are charged a $5 fee to work because the restaurant uses it to cover incidentals like breaking glasses. He said if a server chooses to get paid via direct deposit the restaurant charges a $3 fee for the transaction. 

My cousin and I both gave an additional tip, based on all the info was telling us, but specifically that the 18% charge was not gratuity. As I previously stated, according to the menu it is. That's where the issue lies. 

Overall, I don't think it's worth the price any more. The staff was very kind but you can get a kind staff other places, with the same or better quality food for less. 

I seen in a other review someone mentioned valet being weird. It is lol but it's also complimentary.

photos.caption: See that tiny wing? I wish I took a better angled pic.
Brussels Sprouts $12. Lemon Drop $15. That other drink $20!!!!

comment.text:
Oh my gosh!!! Toast lived up to all of the hype. Came here on a Saturday with my bestie. And yes, you MUST have a reservation because hunty, this place gets packed! 

After checking in, we immediately sat down. 90s and early 2000s R&B bumping in the speakers, dope decor, beautiful looking people....it was a whole vibe! Our server Desiree was so sweet. She helped us answer questions regarding the menu, but both my friend and I already knew what we wanted: the fried lobster and sweet potato/praline waffle that I've seen so many times online. I didn't care how much that thang cost. I needed it in my life! And ya'll, when I tell you....the first bite made my eyes roll back in my head. Like, it was so decadent, it should have been criminal! I literally picked up the fried lobster shell just to dig out the baby bits of leftover meat lol. This place is a must! In the voice of T.I. "Go expeditiously"

OMG I totally recommend this spot for brunch! This place was so nice! The food... the food was phenomenal! I had the lobster waffles and Brussel sprouts and it was amazing! Now the mimosas! So tasty! I finished the entire bottle! The outside patio was pretty cool. They had turf grass out there and a "Toast" background for pics! Let me tell you about my server! She was OUTSTANDING! She answered all our questions, assisted us with ordering and made sure our glasses was full! Ok parking... we'll it's tuff but there is valet and they were good. Just a warning this restaurant can get pretty busy so make sure all parties are there so that you can get seated and expect a wait time.

photos.caption: Brussel sprouts... the sauce was so good!

comment.text:
I decided to take a day off of work for a mental break and went here to start off my day. And what a great way to start the day!

I read reviews that a reservation is a must. But being solo and probably because it was a weekday, I was able to go to Toast and sit at the bar. Absolutely no wait on a Wednesday morning for me. 

When I sat down, the bartender was friendly and assisted me quickly. I asked for a mimosa and she asked which flavor or would I want her to make something. I said make something. I don't what flavor that was for my mimosa but it was REFRESHING!

For my meal, I ordered the chicken and waffles and omg was it excellent! The chicken was flavored and very tender. And the glaze and syrup on the waffles was everything. It was so good I thought about getting me a to go order lol. 

I will be back here and have already told friends this spot is a must!

And a plus is that they do have valet but also pretty sizable parking lot with free parking.

Went as soon it opened, was seated immediately with a party of five. Beautiful atmosphere with r&b music playing. Food was delicious and came out in 15-20 minutes after ordering. Large portion sizes. Our server Desire was extremely welcoming, truly enjoyed her. 10/10 would  come back.

Came in for brunch. Wait was 2hrs and 45 minutes and they don't take reservations. We were told we could stand over to the side and seat ourselves at the next table that becomes available. The hostess gestures over to a corner adjacent to the bar where 2 other parties were standing and waiting. There's no seating or waiting area over there. 

It's obnoxious. 

Why not take reservations? Why have a hostess if you're not going to seat people or time tables to keep the flow moving? 

We didn't stay, of course. Maybe next ATL visit.

I visited during the Memorial Day weekend and was impressed by the restaurant decor and like the fact the staff was very attentive. I had an reservation with Resy and was seated immediately. The restaurant was very full but the server was so nice and funny. I ordered the chicken and waffles. Also, I ordered the ginger drink and it was so fresh. It's an instagram worthy brunch spot and located in a nice area with parking.

The food was super good! First time visiting and I ordered the chicken and waffles with a side of eggs. Perfection! We also got an order of the Banana Fosters French toast. 

Our server was fantastic and accommodating to our requests! Super cute interior and patio area with heat lamps above each booth!

photos.caption: Toast Mimosas. Peach and lavender flavors added.

comment.text:
I came to Toast alone and dined at the bar! The bar is first come, first serve. I waited about 10-15 minutes as one person was before me. 

Food: The absolute best shrimp and grits that I've ever tasted! I checked out other plates and the food looked ah-mazing! I also ordered a mimosa which was well-made!

Parking: I was so scared to visit here because of the parking but the parking was plentiful, easy and free! I noticed complimentary valet but I didn't use it. Nevertheless, I parked on the hill and walked. Very short walk! 

Service: A+ from the hostess to the bartender/server and runner! Food came out in a timely manner.

Toast On Lenox is so worth it! I'm definitely eating here again when i visit ATL again.

photos.caption: Shrimp and Grits - the best ever

comment.text:
I finally got to try Toast and had a great experience!

We got fish and grits with a side of potatoes, fruity pebbles french toast, and the beef short rib skillet and everything was perfect.

There isn't a kids menu but kids can come and they do have booster seats.

photos.caption: Fried Catfish and Grits with roasted potatoes

comment.text: The food was delicious and service was good. Drinks were overpriced. My only main problem was parking .  So aggravating having to find street parking. The tables are also too close. I can hear the conversation of the people around me and vice versa. I probably won't return to this location, I feel more comfortable going to the Lenox location. Tables are further apart and they have a parking lot.

Get here early. This spot still has a big crowd so waiting time is typically 45 mins and up if you come after 11am. The space is a decent size but they crammed a lot of seats into the space to accommodate the guest so the walk ways are very narrow and there's gonna be a lot of walking up and down the aisle as the servers brings out the food and guest come and go. 
On another note, the food and drinks are really good. I can see myself coming back to sit at the bar to indulge in a couple cocktails. 
They're closed Monday & Tuesday. Wednesday-Sunday they are open til 5.

The food was so so so GOOD, I got lobster and waffles and it was Tasting GREAT ! Our cocktail was amazing and we spent an excellent time there! The servers and atmosphere was everything ! If you want to have a great brunch, this is the place to be ! Enjoy !

Went to the midtown location today food was great took a lil min to get our drinks and food but that's to be expected our waitress was great she even had me to try the pimento cheese grits I like nothing pimento cheese  so I told her I would definitely come after her if they were not good they were def a hit!! I give them a 9/10 they ran out of the ricotta pancakes that I really wanted to try space was kind of small and it seemed busy but once we got to our table it was def a vibe would come back if they don't run out of pancakes

photos.caption: Lenox ave breakfast with a side of plain French toast

comment.text: The food situation here is always on point in general.  I have not had a bad meal.  The biscuits were great, shrimp and grits stay on point, but this time I tried the short rib skillet, and that joint was super tasty!  The only downside this trip was the fact that they didn't have a lot of the drinks.  They didn't have all the drinks they listed on the board (ie raspberry lemondrop), couldn't make and amaretto sour, and one other thing.  But the food was solid!

Alright so I was able to finally dine inside! The food was ON POINT!!!! I ordered the shrimp and grits with honey biscuit.  Baby the shrimp and grits was giving me life with no MF parole you hear me baby baby !!
Omg the serviced was amazing , everything was just on point.
Their takeout is trash. Please come experience the service please ! It's top tier .
The inside is small but beautiful and it's decorated really pretty !

photos.caption: Ga Hot Honey Southern fried chicken with greens and yams
Ga Hot Honey Southern fried chicken with greens and yams

comment.text: Completely worth the hype. The short rib hash is that girl! If you plan to dine in without reservations, be intentional about the time that you go and the size of your party. Folks dining solo or with one other person can snag bar seats. Large parties without reservations may be SOL. The food is spectacular.

Make sure you make a reservation...
If your with friends.. order different entrees and split because you will want everything ! And everything is SO GOOD !! 

Service and Ambiance was amazing and I didn't feel rushed at all 10/10

photos.caption: The list of mimosa flavors is ENDLESS !!! Pinapple Mango in pic...
Shrimp & Grits, Strawberry & Banana French Toast, Salmon Croquettes, Hot chicken, and Mac & cheese
